name: Turret Cannon
effect: At the end of the Engineer's turn, attack the nearest hostile character in Range with this weapon.

name: Perimiter Cannon
effect:
At the end of the Engineer's turn, attack the nearest hostile character in Range with this weapon.
1/round, the Deployable Turret may Overwatch with this weapon.

name: Skyshield Turret
effect: The Deployable Turret gains +1 Accuracy against flying targets.

name: Fortified Turret
effect: The Deployable Turret is Size 1. Adjacent allied characters can use the Deployable Turret as hard cover.

name: Pulse Snare
effect: When hostile characters move into or start their turn within range 3 of the Titan-Snare Drone, it emits a pulse, and they become Immobilized until the drone is destroyed.

name: Forward Observer
effect:
The Flare Drone creates a Burst 2 area of bright light. All characters in the affected area - including those who move into the area or start their turn within it - lose Invisible and Hidden, and cannot Hide or turn Invisible within the area. Additionally, the Bombard gains +1 Accuracy to attacks against characters in the affected area.

Only one Flare Drone can be deployed at any time. If the Bombard that deployed this Flare Drone deploys another, this one is immediately destroyed.

name: Unstoppable
effect: The Hound Missile is immune to Prone, Slowed, and Immobilized. Any hostile character that attempts to move a Hound Missile (i.e. with Knockback, push, pull, etc.) must pass a contested Systems check against the Rainmaker. If they fail, the movement is ignored, that character gains Lock On, and the Rainmaker may change the missile's target to that character.

name: Target Acquired
effect:
At the end of the Rainmaker's turn, the Hound Missile makes a standard move, flying 3 spaces towards its target, 6 spaces if its target has Lock On. It moves directly, maneuvering around cover and terrain if needed.

When the Hound Missile moves adjacent to its target, or collides with any character, it creates a Burst 1 explosion. Characters caught in the affected area must make an Agility save or take {16/20/24} Explosive damage. On a success, they take half damage.

name: Rearm / Repair
effect: If an allied character moves through or adjacent to the Restock Drone, they regain {5/8/10} HP or reload one Loading weapon. The Restock Drone is then immediately destroyed.

name: System Link
effect:
The Latch Drone moves with and occupies the same space as its target character. Hostile characters can attack the drone as normal.

Only one Latch Drone can be deployed at any time. If the Support that deployed this Latch Drone deploys another, this one is immediately destroyed.

name: Supercharger
effect: While the Latch Drone is attached to a character, they regain {5/8/10} HP at the start of each of their turns and gain +1 Accuracy on all checks, saves, and attacks.

name: Guardian
effect: The Barricade Cubeis a Size 2 object. All characters may use the Barricade Cube as hard cover.

name: Spike Barrier
effect: When any character other than the Barricade moves adjacent to the Barricade Cube for the first time in a round, they must pass an Agility save or immediately take {2/3/4} AP Kinetic damage and lose all their remaining movement, as if they had become Engaged. On a success, they take the damage only.

name: Roiling Shroud
effect: Allied characters who are at least partially within the Razor Swarm gain soft cover. Hostile characters who start their turn or move at least partially within the Razor Swarm for the first time in a round take {2/3/4} Burn.

name: Driving Swarm
effect: Characters who take damage from the Razor Swarm must pass a Systems save or immediately move 4 spaces in a direction chosen by the Hive. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: Electro Nanites
effect: Characters who take damage from the Razor Swarm make all saves and checks at +1 Difficulty, and all tech attacks made against them gain +1 Accuracy.

name: Unstoppable
effect: The Wolfhound Missile is immune to Prone, Slowed, and Immobilized. Any hostile character that attempts to move a Hound Missile (i.e. with Knockback, push, pull, etc.) must pass a contested Systems check against the Ultra. If they fail, the movement is ignored, that character gains Lock On, and the Ultra may change the missile's target to that character.

name: Target Acquired
effect:
At the end of the Ultra's turn, the Wolfhound Missile makes a standard move, flying 4 spaces towards its target, 8 spaces if its target has Lock On. It moves directly, maneuvering around cover and terrain if needed.

When the Wolfhound Missile moves adjacent to its target, or collides with any character, it creates a Burst 2 explosion. Characters caught in the affected area must make an Agility save or take {14/20/28} Explosive damage. On a success, they take half damage.
